image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds.

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds is suing Ms Reynolds and her fiancé David Sharaz over social media posts made in July last year.

title.children: Brittany Higgins fails in bid to delay defamation trial brought by Senator Linda Reynolds

image.altText: The Indian flag and Mike Burgess.

props.synopsis: Indian spies were kicked out of Australia after being caught trying to steal secrets about sensitive defence projects and airport security, as well as classified information on Australia's trade relationships.

title.children: India's Modi government operated 'nest of spies' in Australia before being disrupted by ASIO

image.altText: Aerial view over rivermouth and foreshore lined with trees

props.synopsis: Green hydrogen technology is touted as a way to fight climate change, but this tourist town is concerned about its impact on the local environment.

title.children: Why is a small beach town against a renewable technology that could help the planet?

image.altText: A headshot of a man next to a sign outside Roebourne Police station.

props.synopsis: Police believe a 40-year-old man left a carrier moored at Cape Lambert, before swimming ashore.

title.children: Police searching for missing seafearer who jumped ship in WA's Pilbara

image.altText: Ninette Simons with severe facial bruising some days after the attack.

props.synopsis: Assault victim Ninette Simons has become the human embodiment of a saga that has been engulfing the federal government for six months.

title.children: The bloodied and bruised image that puts a human face on the High Court fallout

image.altText: Two police forensics officers and a uniformed officer stand on a residential street looking at something on the ground.

props.synopsis: A 54-year-old man appears in court in Fremantle after allegedly murdering his mother at a home in Yangebup in Perth's south.

title.children: Police charge son with murder of 78-year-old woman at home in Perth's south

image.altText: Dozens of beached whales thrashing in the shallows.

props.synopsis: On the surface pilot whales appear to be the world's most poorly-named mammal but scientists say there is likely more to their beachings than a radar that has gone awry.

title.children: Scientists racing to solve the mystery of why pilot whales lose their bearings

image.altText: Powerlines suspended between towers against orange dusk  sky.

props.synopsis: Australians hoping for energy bill relief next financial year have been delivered a blow, with the cost of energy transmission set to rise in different parts of the country.

title.children: Your energy bill will likely rise as power companies put up their costs over the next five years

image.altText: Kate Colvin, with short grey hair and wearing a black blazer, stands against a beige wall and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Violence is the biggest cause of homelessness for women and children, says Homelessness Australia CEO Kate Colvin, who has called on the federal government to "confront this challenge".

title.children: Government must confront challenge of housing women and children fleeing violence, homelessness advocate says

image.altText: People board plane on tarmac

props.synopsis: The airline says it has "temporarily" suspended all services, leaving travellers scrambling for help to get to their destinations.

title.children: Passengers stranded, Bonza in administration in 'shattering news' for sector

image.altText: An Airnorth Embraer 170 jet.

props.synopsis: Flights between Broome and Kununurra are set to be capped at $199 one way, and the government will extend subsidies for flights between Perth and some regional WA towns.

title.children: Cheaper flights in WA's north on the way as state government extends subsidies

image.altText: Flooded house in Norman Park in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Floods, bushfires, and severe storms send insurance costs skyrocketing. It's high time for Australia to heed warnings from other parts of the world before insurance becomes unaffordable for all Australians — or simply unavailable.

title.children: All Australians will foot the bill after climate disasters leave insurance industry on the brink

image.altText: Hannah Green holds LA Championship trophy

props.synopsis: Five-time LPGA Tour winner Hannah Green has entered the world's top 10 for the first time, thanks to her win in the LA Championship.

title.children: Hannah Green's rise puts two Perth golfers in world top 10

image.altText: Two formally-dressed women walk next to each other with a man walking near them.

props.synopsis: The Queensland senator told court today that when she tweeted that Senator Mehreen Faruqi should "piss off back to Pakistan", she didn't realise the Greens senator was Muslim or that 97 per cent of the Pakistani population was Muslim.

title.children: Pauline Hanson tells court she didn't know fellow senator was Muslim when she tweeted she should go 'back to Pakistan'

image.altText: Police standing outside an apartment with tape.

props.synopsis: The body of a 19-year-old woman has been found in an apartment in Sydney's eastern suburbs.

title.children: NSW Police confirm body of young woman found in North Bondi apartment

image.altText: A composite image of four fair-skinned men, three of whom are in military uniform.

props.synopsis: The independent inquiry is examining the circumstances leading up to the crash that claimed the lives of four army personnel in July 2023.

title.children: Father of soldier killed in Taipan helicopter crash tells inquiry son had safety concerns

image.altText: A phone with the TikTok logo displayed.

props.synopsis: A Canberra grandmother escapes conviction for filming a video containing child abuse material of her granddaughter and posting it privately to social media platform TikTok, in a case ACT Supreme Court Justice Belinda Baker described as "highly unusual".

title.children: Canberra woman avoids jail for posting video of granddaughter identified as child abuse material by TikTok

image.altText: A bonza aircraft on a runway

props.synopsis: Budget airline Bonza enters voluntary administration after this morning cancelling all flights, leaving passengers stranded. Follow live.

title.children: Bonza enters voluntary administration after cancelling all flights

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Problem appears to be with US-backer 777 Partners, expert says

image.altText: A man in glasses and a brown shirt stands at a lectern delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: Manasseh Sogavare switched his country's diplomatic relations from Taiwan to China and amplified combative stoushes with Western democracies. What does his departure as prime minister mean for Solomon Islands and the region?

title.children: China's man in the Pacific has been booted out of office — and Australia is breathing a sigh of relief

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a goal in a soccer match

props.synopsis: Four-time Golden Boot winner and all-time leading A-League Men's topscorer Jamie Maclaren has announced he will leave Melbourne City at the end of the season, closing the door on one of the competition's great careers.

title.children: All-time A-League Men's top scorer Jamie Maclaren to depart Melbourne City at season's end

image.altText: A woman with curly blonde hair and a woman with dark straight hair sit either side of a yellow and black text-based artwork.

props.synopsis: Despite pledges made by major galleries to address gender inequity, male artists are still over-represented in solo shows in state and commercial galleries and major museums.

title.children: A damning new report shows that women are still not being represented fairly in Australian galleries

image.altText: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese attends a rally to a call for action to end violence against women.

props.synopsis: A national register for offenders, electronic monitoring and national coordination of intelligence on serial violent offenders could be on the agenda at a meeting of state leaders at the national cabinet tomorrow to discuss violence against women.

title.children: National register for violent offenders, electronic monitoring — what is on the table for national cabinet

image.altText: A view of sheds and ovakl at Heber Park in Hebersham.

props.synopsis: NSW Police charged a 24-year-old man who allegedly stabbed another man and chased others with a knife at Hebersham in Sydney's west.

title.children: Children were in Sydney park when man armed with knife chased people, slashed man's neck

image.altText: Two men standing together smiling, holding a newspaper article titled "these boys should be friends for life"

props.synopsis: As Ross Wall floated, unconscious, in Perth's Swan River as an 11-year-old in 1957, the quick-thinking actions of Graham Caporn, 10, saved his life, forging a lifelong bond.

title.children: It's been 67 years since Graham rescued Ross from Perth's Swan River, and they are friends to this day

image.altText: Bakery goods on bench, croissants very visible with prices next to them

props.synopsis: At a popular bakery which has become widely shared on social media, a business owner has asked customers to not include staff faces when taking photos or videos.

title.children: Why this Hobart bakery told customers to stop filming staff

image.altText: Police vehicles parked at crime scene.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old girl will remain in custody after being charged over the fatal stabbing of her younger sister in a suburb of Lake Macquarie in New South Wales.

title.children: Teenage girl charged with murder of her 10-year-old sister after stabbing at Lake Macquarie

image.altText: A man stands on an airport runway with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: The company entered voluntary administration within hours of the cancellations. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Who owns Bonza airlines? And why is the company in trouble?

image.altText: Detail shot of Horsehead Nebula's mane. It looks like swirling ocean foam.

props.synopsis: NASA's James Webb Telescope has captured the most detailed infrared images ever taken of the Horsehead Nebula, one of the most majestic and recognisable objects in the night sky, the space agency says.

title.children: James Webb Telescope captures iconic Horsehead Nebula in unprecedented detail

image.altText: close up of woman on phone with person hugging from behind

props.synopsis: There are many reasons a romantic partner may need to borrow money, including emergencies, existing debt, or loss of income. What are the risks of loaning it to them?

title.children: The questions to ask before lending a partner money

image.altText: A black and white portrait of Prince William and Catherine on their wedding day.

props.synopsis: A new photo of the Prince and Princess of Wales on their wedding day has been published on the couple's social media accounts to mark their 13th wedding anniversary.

title.children: New photo from Prince William and Kate's wedding published for anniversary

image.altText: A closeup photo of a computer chip

props.synopsis: The Queensland and Australian governments have set aside $470 million each to build "the most complex machine ever built by humanity" in Brisbane. So how does it work?

title.children: Australia makes billion-dollar play for world's first commercial quantum computer

image.altText: A group of people wearing masks holding up signs and flags.

props.synopsis: The student protesters were given a form to sign, acknowledging they would be suspended for their participation.

title.children: Columbia University begins suspending pro-Palestinian activists for refusing to pack up and leave New York campus

image.altText: A woman in a crowd holds a sign saying "Stop Killing Us".

props.synopsis: As thousands of people rallied against the scourge of domestic violence over the weekend, some of Perth's under-pressure women's shelters turned away women who were at risk of being killed.

title.children: Domestic violence supports at breaking point as housing affordability exacerbates 'national crisis' of gendered violence
